term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - apparent viscosity of a liquid
term.title: apparent viscosity

item.text: The ratio of stress to rate of strain, calculated from measurements of forces and velocities as though the liquid were Newtonian. If the liquid is actually non-Newtonian, the apparent viscosity depends on the type and dimensions of the apparatus used.

sources.item: PAC, 1979, 51, 1213. 'Terminology and Symbols in Colloid and Surface Chemistry Part 1.13. Definitions, Terminology and Symbols for Rheological Properties' on page 1217 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac197951051213)
